thread.title: UK could run out of drinking water within days of no-deal Brexit - Devon Live

author: Dan Bloom
title: UK could run out of drinking water within days of no-deal Brexit - Devon Live
text:
Environment Secretary Michael Gove leaves his home in London
Britain could run out of clean drinking water just days after a no-deal Brexit, according to leaked contingency plans.
The shock warning was contained in Whitehall's contingency plan Operation Yellowhammer - and reportedly convinced Michael Gove to back the deal, The Mirror reports .
Suppliers add chemicals including fluorosilicic acid, aluminium sulphate, calcium hydroxide and sodium silicofluoride to make water safe to drink. Environment Secretary Michael Gove leaves his home in London
But those are timed to arrive 'just in time' and cannot be stockpiled as they are too volatile.
Plans leaked to the Mail on Sunday warned if they run out, households could "immediately face a shortage of drinking water and inability to flush toilets, cook, wash clothes or keep themselves clean". Read More
